intro: Phyllanthus quinquefidus, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows up to 2 meters tall, characterized by its small, green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, round seeds. Phyllanthus quinquefidus is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often used in traditional medicine.
